Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Inferiority \In*fe`ri*or"i*ty\, [Cf. F. inf['e]riorit['e].] The state of being inferior; a lower state or condition; as, inferiority of rank, of talents, of age, of worth. [1913 Webster]
A deep sense of our own great inferiority. --Boyle. [1913 Webster]

inferiority n 1: the state of being inferior [syn: {lower status}, {lower rank}] 2: an inferior quality [syn: {low quality}] [ant: {superiority}, {superiority}] 3: the quality of being a competitive disadvantage [syn: {unfavorable position}]
